DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Substance Morphology Contrast-enhanced MRI Quality Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Qualitative degree of contrast enhancement is defined as having all or portions of the tumor that demonstrate significantly higher signal on the postcontrast T1W images compared to precontrast T1W images.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lesion Substance Morphology Contrast-enhanced MRI Quality
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._A material with particular features._Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same._A technique that uses radiofrequency waves and a magnet to image the body.  The images are enhanced by the addition of contrast agents which selectively intensify anatomical regions to intensify the clarity of the image for diagnostic purposes. 2005_Quality; a degree or grade of excellence or worth; an essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A material with particular features.:Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.

Property.preferredDefinition: A technique that uses radiofrequency waves and a magnet to image the body.  The images are enhanced by the addition of contrast agents which selectively intensify anatomical regions to intensify the clarity of the image for diagnostic purposes. 2005:Quality; a degree or grade of excellence or worth; an essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone.

Concepts.definition: A technique that uses radiofrequency waves and a magnet to image the body.  The images are enhanced by the addition of contrast agents which selectively intensify anatomical regions to intensify the clarity of the image for diagnostic purposes. 2005
An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/16/11 - upd for VASARI 3.0 Key (1/14/2011); DEC released.  5/27/09 used by VASARI F4 feature item.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive._Quality; a degree or grade of excellence or worth; an essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: When barely discernible but unequivocal degree of enhancement is present relative to pre-contrast images.
It appears that contrast was not injected.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.:Quality; a degree or grade of excellence or worth; an essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive.
An essential and distinguishing attribute of something or someone; a degree or grade of excellence or worth.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/16/11 - update enumerated values per VASARI 3.0 Key (1/14/2011); VD released.  5/28/09 created for VASARI F4 feature question

ReferenceDocuments.name: VASARI Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: If it does not appear that contrast was administered, select No Contrast Injected.

DataElement.changeDescription: 9/2/11 upd origin to VASARI.  8/16/11 - updated for VASARI 3.0 Key (1/14/2011); added Alt question and comment; CDE released.  5/28/09 describes the F4 feature of VASARI images.
